Kamodia





(Kamodia wakes up, crawling out from under the cover, she conv=
erts to robot mode, she takes the blanket, wrapping it around her waist. Sh=
e frowns, picking up a small backpack, taking out a pad of paper and a pen.=
) 



She writes: Hey, this is Kamodia. You may hate me for what I have don=
e, of course, I think it's for the best. And Arcangel, sorry, but I've left=
 to find a new home, from the start, things haven't worked out for me. It s=
eems your the hero of this group, and it doesn't matter what you say, we we=
ren't meant to be, you seem so busy, and if I can only see for a few minute=
s every two week, then I think it's best we don't see each other at all. We=
ll, we may see each other again, but we may be enemies. I haven't decided w=
here to go yet. I decided to leave this note, so you'll know what happened.=
 Sorry, I wish you and the Maximals, good luck. Once again, I am sorry....I=
 have left ....Bye...

Love, Kamodia....



(Kamodia takes a piece of tape =
and an envelope from her backpack, and uses the tape to stick the note and =
the envelope on her room's door. She puts the pad of paper back into her ba=
ckpack. She takes her Maximal symbol off her shoulder, and slides it into t=
he envelope, and closes it, writing the word "Arcangel" on it. She sighs an=
d puts the pen in her back pack. She hangs the backpack over her shoulder, =
walking to the front of the base, and exitting.)


(She takes one more look=
 at the base, frowning, she walks on, looking for another base, and a new t=
eam.)
